subsection.content: The Authority may cause or permit the installation of such automatic toll collection facility at such toll booth at a booth mode tunnel as the Authority may approve for the purpose of collecting the tolls payable for the use of the tunnel and may cause or permit the installation of such ancillary facilities as the Authority may approve. (20 of 2021 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority, or an operator with the approval of the Authority, may designate a toll booth at which an automatic toll collection facility is installed under paragraph (1) as an autotoll booth— (E.R. 1 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by displaying at the side of the toll booth a traffic sign of the type shown in Figure No. 14A prescribed in Schedule 1. (L.N. 96 of 2009)

subsection.content: The Authority or an operator for the purpose of informing the users of an autotoll booth may cause or permit to be displayed at the autotoll booth any traffic sign of the types shown in Figure Nos. 12 and 13 prescribed in Schedule 1. (L.N. 96 of 2009)

An electronic toll pass may be issued by the Authority or by an operator to a person who opens an account with the Authority or with an operator, as the case may be, for the payment of the toll appropriate to the passage through the tunnel of the description of vehicle in respect of which the electronic toll pass is issued.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Boothless mode tunnel: installation of boothless tolling facilities
section.content: The Authority may install or permit the installation of boothless tolling facilities and any ancillary facilities at a tunnel for it to be operated as a boothless mode tunnel.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Fee for removal of vehicles etc. causing obstruction
section.content: Where a vehicle or thing causing an obstruction in any tunnel has been removed under section 15 of the Ordinance, the Authority may require the owner of such vehicle or thing to pay the removal fee (if any) specified in the Table in section 2 of Part 4 of Schedule 2 in relation to the tunnel.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall in any tunnel drive a vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the width (including any load and any equipment attached to the vehicle) of which exceeds 2.5 m; (L.N. 196 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the length (including any load and any equipment attached to the vehicle) of which exceeds 12 m; (L.N. 196 of 1984)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is towing another vehicle; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that is drawing a trailer and the combined length of the vehicle and trailer (including drawbar and any load) exceeds 16 m, (L.N. 196 of 1984)

subsection.continued: other than in accordance with the conditions of a permit issued by the Authority for the passage of that vehicle.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: No person shall drive within the tunnel area of the Cross-Harbour Tunnel, Eastern Harbour Crossing, Western Harbour Crossing or Tai Lam Tunnel a vehicle— (7 of 2016 s. 13; 18 of 2023 s. 18; 3 of 2025 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the height of which (including load) exceeds 4.6 m; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with a wheel-load exceeding 4.5 tonnes or an axle load exceeding 11 tonnes,

subsection.continued: other than in accordance with the conditions of a permit issued by the Authority for the passage of that vehicle. (49 of 1999 s. 10)

subsection.content: Any such permit shall be subject to such conditions as the Authority may impose.

Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (2), the Authority may require that a vehicle being the subject of a permit issued under this regulation shall only pass through a tunnel when accompanied by such escort vehicle as the Authority may provide.

subsection.leadIn: Except in case of emergency, application for a permit shall be made not less than 48 hours before the intended passage and shall contain the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: details of the vehicle and its load; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time, date and direction of the proposed passage.

subsection.content: The permit fee (if any) specified in Part 5 of Schedule 2 in relation to a tunnel shall be paid on the issue of a permit for the passage of a vehicle through the tunnel. (44 of 1999 s. 34; L.N. 96 of 2009; 7 of 2016 s. 13)
The driver of a vehicle in respect of the passage of which a permit has been issued shall immediately when asked for it produce the permit for inspection by an authorized officer.
A vehicle which carries an authorized officer who is engaged on duty shall be exempt from regulations 3(6), 3A, 4(2), 6, 8(2)(d), 8A(2)(c) and 14(1)(c). (L.N. 60 of 2017)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A vehicle towing another vehicle and carrying an authorized officer who is engaged on duty is exempt from regulation 8AA(2) and (3). (L.N. 72 of 2018)

A fire service vehicle, ambulance, police vehicle and vehicle used for defence purposes, including civil defence purposes shall, if the vehicle is being used in the course of urgent duty, be exempt from regulations 10(e) and (f), 11 and 11A.

subsection.leadIn: A specified bus is exempt from regulation 14(1)(a) in relation to a tunnel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is in force a Cap. 374A approval in relation to the width of the bus; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval applies in relation to the use of the tunnel by the bus and does not contain a term or condition to the effect that the use is restricted. (L.N. 147 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A specified bus is exempt from regulation 14(1)(b) in relation to a tunnel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is in force a Cap. 374A approval in relation to the length of the bus; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval applies in relation to the use of the tunnel by the bus and does not contain a term or condition to the effect that the use is restricted. (L.N. 147 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: Cap. 374A (《第374A章》) means the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exemption from regulation 6(1) of Cap. 374A granted under regulation 4 of Cap. 374A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a permit given under regulation 6(2) of Cap. 374A;

subsection.def: specified bus (指明巴士) means a bus that is not an articulated vehicle as defined by regulation 2 of Cap. 374A. (L.N. 147 of 2021)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Saving
section.content: Any sign erected in the Lion Rock Tunnel under the Lion Rock Tunnel Regulations (Cap. 140 sub. leg., 1978 Ed.) immediately before the coming into operation* of these regulations and then complying with the Lion Rock Tunnel Regulations (Cap. 140 sub. leg., 1978 Ed.) shall for so long as it continues to comply therewith be deemed to have the same effect as if the Lion Rock Tunnel Ordinance (Cap. 140, 1974 Ed.) had not been repealed.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Miscellaneous offences
section.leadIn: No person shall in any tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permit an animal to be therein otherwise than in a vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paint or affix or cause to be painted or affixed any poster, placard, bill, advertisement or other matter except with the permission of the Authority; or (L.N. 251 of 1991)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: interfere with any traffic sign, road marking, lane marker, light, telephone or other fitting or fixture. (7 of 2016 s. 14)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes any of the provisions of regulation 3A, 4(2), 6, 8, 8AA, 8A, 9, 10, 11(1), 11A(2), 14(1), (1A) or (6) or 17, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 212 of 1986; L.N. 60 of 2017; L.N. 72 of 2018; 20 of 2021 s. 31)

Any person who while driving a vehicle in any tunnel fails to conform to the indication of any traffic sign of the type shown in any of the Figure Nos. 1 to 6 inclusive prescribed in Schedule 1 and displayed at a tunnel under regulation 3(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 212 of 1986; L.N. 96 of 2009; 7 of 2016 s. 15)

Any person who while driving a vehicle in any tunnel fails to conform to the indication of any traffic sign of the type shown in Figure No. 10, 11, 14 or 14A prescribed in Schedule 1 and displayed at a tunnel under regulation 3(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (L.N. 212 of 1986; L.N. 300 of 1993; L.N. 96 of 2009; 7 of 2016 s. 15)

Any person who while driving a vehicle in any tunnel fails to conform to the indication of any traffic sign or road marking prescribed by the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G) displayed at a tunnel under regulation 3(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months. (L.N. 212 of 1986)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Offences relating to boothless tolling facilities etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prevent the detection by boothless tolling facilities of the use of a tunnel by a vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: cause any boothless tolling facilities—

subparagraph.content: to fail to operate; or
to operate in a manner that results in underpayment of an appropriate toll;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: tamper or interfere with, or cause damage to or defacement or alteration of, any boothless tolling facilities; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: tamper or interfere with, or cause damage to or defacement or alteration of, or access without lawful authority, any record, information or system kept or operated by or for the Government or toll service provider in relation to the collection and recovery of tolls.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes paragraph (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
This regulation does not affect the operation of regulations 17 and 18.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Powers of an operator
section.content: An operator may exercise such powers conferred on the Authority under regulations 3(1), (1C) and (2), 3A, 4, 5, 11A, 12AAB(2) and (3), 13 and 14(1), (1A), (2) and (3) on such terms and conditions as may be specified by the Authority.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Transitional Provisions in Relation to Division 17 of Part 3 of Dangerous Goods (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2021

section.name: s20
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IV
section.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which Division 17 of Part 3 of the Dangerous Goods (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2021 (29 of 2021) comes into operation;
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 24 months beginning on the commencement date.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Contravention of regulation 11(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) or 11A(2)
section.content: A contravention of regulation 11(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) or 11A(2) (as the case may be) during the transitional period does not constitute an offence under regulation 18(1) if the act or omission that constitutes the contravention, had it happened before the commencement date, would not have constituted a contravention of regulation 11(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) or 11A(2) (as the case may be) in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Transitional provisions—conformance to indication of traffic sign relating to dangerous goods

subsection.content: Paragraph (2) applies if during the transitional period an act or omission of a person constitutes a failure to comply with the requirement indicated by Figure No. 6 traffic sign (new requirement).

The person does not contravene regulation 3(6)(a) in relation to the new requirement and the failure to comply with the new requirement does not constitute an offence under regulation 18(2) if the act or omission does not constitute a failure to comply with the old requirement.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: Figure No. 6 traffic sign (第6號圖形交通標誌) means a traffic sign of the type shown in Figure No. 6 prescribed in Schedule 1;
pre-amended Schedule 1 (前附表1) means Schedule 1 in force immediately before the commencement date.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Traffic Signs and Road Markings

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 1—Lane Signal (with arrow).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 1—Lane Signal (with arrow).

schedule.text: This sign when displayed conveys to vehicular traffic proceeding in the traffic lane above and in relation to which it is displayed that traffic may proceed or continue to do so in the said lane beneath or beyond the said arrow and in the direction opposite to that in which the arrow faces. It may also be used at a toll booth to indicate that vehicles may proceed in that lane.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 2—Lane Signal (with cross).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 2—Lane Signal (with cross).

schedule.text: This sign when displayed conveys to vehicular traffic proceeding in the traffic lane above and in relation to which it is displayed the prohibition that such traffic shall not proceed beneath or beyond the red cross in the said traffic lane in the direction opposite to that in which the red cross faces. It may also be used at a toll booth to indicate that vehicles may not proceed in that lane.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 3—Proceed Right or Keep Right, Proceed Left or Keep Left.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 3—Proceed Right or Keep Right, Proceed Left or Keep Left.

schedule.text: The direction of the arrow may be reversed to give—

This sign indicates that vehicles must proceed or keep to the lane on the right-hand side (or to the lane on the left-hand side if the direction of the arrow is reversed) of the lane above which the sign is displayed.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 4—Lane Signal (from top to down: red cross, amber light and green arrow).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 4—Lane Signal (from top to down: red cross, amber light and green arrow).

section.name: s0
section.text: The signal may in a tunnel area be placed in a vertical or horizontal position above or at the side of a traffic lane for the control of that traffic proceeding along the traffic lane over or at the side of and in relation to which the signals have been placed. Provided that when the signal is placed above the traffic lane the green arrow shall point downwards.
section.leadIn: The significance of the signal shall be as follows—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: When a green arrow is displayed vehicular traffic proceeding in the traffic lane above or at the side of and in relation to which it is displayed may proceed along that lane.

When a steady or intermittent amber light is displayed vehicular traffic proceeding in the traffic lane above or at the side of and in relation to which it is displayed shall proceed along that lane with caution and be prepared to stop, provided that the amber light may be omitted from any signal installation when the signal shall consist of a light capable of showing a red cross and a light capable of showing a green arrow.

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: When a red cross is displayed vehicular traffic proceeding in the traffic lane above or at the side of and in relation to which it is displayed shall not proceed beneath or beyond or past the red cross.

section.continued: The signal may be used at toll booths.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 4A—Lane Signal (from left to right: green arrow, amber light and red cross).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 4A—Lane Signal (from left to right: green arrow, amber light and red cross).

schedule.text: This signal may be placed above or at the side of a lane for controlling the traffic proceeding along the lane.
If the signal displaying a green arrow is placed above a lane, the green arrow must point downwards.
The signal indicates that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when a green arrow is displayed—vehicles may proceed along the lane;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when a steady or intermittent amber light is displayed—
vehicles must proceed along the lane with caution; and
vehicles must be prepared to stop; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when a red cross is displayed—vehicles must not proceed beneath, beyond or past the signal.

schedule.text: The signal may also be placed at the side of a toll booth. In that case, for a vehicle passing through a toll booth, the signal indicates that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when a green arrow is displayed—
the toll has been paid in respect of the vehicle, or no toll is payable in respect of it; and
the vehicle may proceed beyond or past the signal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when a red cross is displayed—
the toll has not been paid in respect of the vehicle; and
the vehicle must not proceed beyond or past the signal.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 5—Keep in Lane.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 5—Keep in Lane.

schedule.text: This sign indicates that vehicles must keep in their lanes.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 6—Dangerous Goods Prohibited.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 6—Dangerous Goods Prohibited.

schedule.text: This sign indicates that vehicles carrying dangerous goods of particular classes are prohibited from passing beyond the sign.
It may be used in conjunction with the sign in Figure No. 7.

img.alt: The image is Figure No. 7—Classes 1, 2, 3, 3A.
img.title: The image is Figure No. 7—Classes 1, 2, 3, 3A.

schedule.text: This sign when used in conjunction with the sign in Figure No. 6 indicates the class or classes of dangerous goods referred to in that figure.

img.alt: The image is Figure No. 7A—Toll Area.
img.title: The image is Figure No. 7A—Toll Area.

schedule.text: This sign indicates the start of the toll area.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 8—Tunnel Area.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 8—Tunnel Area.

schedule.text: This sign indicates the start of the area where the prohibitions and restrictions imposed by the Road Tunnels (Government) Ordinance (Cap. 368) and the Road Tunnels (Government) Regulations (Cap. 368 sub. leg. A) apply.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 9—Tunnel Area End.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 9—Tunnel Area End.

schedule.text: This sign indicates the end of the area where the prohibitions and restrictions imposed by the Road Tunnels (Government) Ordinance (Cap. 368) and the Road Tunnels (Government) Regulations (Cap. 368 sub. leg. A) apply.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 10—No Change Toll Sign.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 10—No Change Toll Sign.

schedule.text: When this sign is displayed at a toll booth it indicates that the toll booth is for use only by drivers paying the correct toll as indicated on the sign and requiring no change to be given.
The toll shown on the sign may be varied to suit the particular circumstances.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 11—No Change Toll Sign (with arrow).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 11—No Change Toll Sign (with arrow).

schedule.text: When this sign is displayed over a toll booth or booths adjacent to a traffic lane or lanes as indicated by the downward pointing arrows on the sign it indicates that the toll booth or booths are for use only by drivers paying the correct toll as indicated on the sign and requiring no change to be given.
The number of arrows and the overall dimensions of the sign and the toll shown on the sign may be varied to suit the particular circumstances.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 12—Autotoll Payment Signal.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 12—Autotoll Payment Signal.

schedule.text: The signal is placed in a vertical position at the side of a traffic lane dedicated for use of an automatic toll collection system. It may be used in conjunction with Figure No. 13.
schedule.leadIn: The significance of the signal shall be as follows—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: The display of a red signal indicates that appropriate toll payment has not been made.

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: The display of a green signal indicates that appropriate toll payment has been made.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 13—Autotoll Account Balance Signal.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 13—Autotoll Account Balance Signal.

schedule.text: The signal is placed in a vertical position at the side of a traffic lane dedicated for use of an automatic toll collection system. It may be used in conjunction with Figure No. 12.
schedule.leadIn: The significance of the signal shall be as follows—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: The display of the red dollar sign indicates that the account balance with the authority or the operator in respect of the electronic toll pass is nil.

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: The display of the amber dollar sign indicates that the account balance with the authority or the operator in respect of the electronic toll pass is less than the amount specified by the authority or the operator.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 14—Traffic Lane (Autotoll Only).
img.title: This image is Figure No. 14—Traffic Lane (Autotoll Only).

schedule.text: This sign is displayed above a traffic lane that leads to an autotoll booth. It indicates that only a vehicle with a valid electronic toll pass the account of which is opened in respect of the vehicle may proceed in the traffic lane.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 14A—Autotoll Booth.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 14A—Autotoll Booth.

schedule.text: When this sign is displayed at the side of a toll booth it indicates that the toll booth is an autotoll booth. It may be used in conjunction with the sign in Figure No. 14 and it indicates that only a vehicle with a valid electronic toll pass the account of which is opened in respect of the vehicle may pass through the autotoll booth.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 17—Use Dipped Headlights.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 17—Use Dipped Headlights.

schedule.text: When this sign is displayed, all traffic is to proceed through the tunnel using dipped headlights.
The overall dimensions and display of the sign may be varied to suit the particular circumstances.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 18—Height Gauge.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 18—Height Gauge.

schedule.text: When the stop sign is displayed all vehicles should stop until instructed to proceed by an authorized officer.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 23—Keep Left Sign for Left-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 23—Keep Left Sign for Left-driving Tunnel.

ins.inline: Keep Left Sign for Left-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that buses, medium and heavy goods vehicles must keep to the left most lane of a road inside a tube of a left-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 24—Transverse Yellow Bar Markings.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 24—Transverse Yellow Bar Markings.

schedule.text: This marking indicates to drivers the need to reduce the speed of their vehicles.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 25—Keep to Right Most Lane in Right-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 25—Keep to Right Most Lane in Right-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Right Most Lane in Right-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that buses must keep to the right most lane of a road inside a tube of a right-driving tunnel.

The word and characters “BUSES” and “巴士” may be replaced by the descriptions of any other motor vehicles to indicate that such vehicles must keep to the right most lane of a road inside a tube of a right-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 25A—Keep to Left Most Lane in Left-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 25A—Keep to Left Most Lane in Left-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Left Most Lane in Left-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that buses must keep to the left most lane of a road inside a tube of a left-driving tunnel.

The word and characters “BUSES” and “巴士” may be replaced by the descriptions of any other motor vehicles to indicate that such vehicles must keep to the left most lane of a road inside a tube of a left-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 26—Keep to Right Most Lane or Middle Lane in Right-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 26—Keep to Right Most Lane or Middle Lane in Right-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Right Most Lane or Middle Lane in Right-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that medium goods vehicles and heavy goods vehicles must keep to the right most lane, or the middle lane, of a road inside a tube of a right-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 26A—Keep to Left Most Lane or Middle Lane in Left-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 26A—Keep to Left Most Lane or Middle Lane in Left-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Left Most Lane or Middle Lane in Left-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that medium goods vehicles and heavy goods vehicles must keep to the left most lane, or the middle lane, of a road inside a tube of a left-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 27—Keep to Two Lanes on the Right in Right-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 27—Keep to Two Lanes on the Right in Right-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Two Lanes on the Right in Right-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that medium goods vehicles and heavy goods vehicles must keep to the right most lane, or the lane next to the right most lane, of a road inside a tube of a right-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This image is Figure No. 28—Keep to Two Lanes on the Left in Left-driving Tunnel.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 28—Keep to Two Lanes on the Left in Left-driving Tunnel.

inline.inline: Keep to Two Lanes on the Left in Left-driving Tunnel

schedule.text: This sign indicates that buses, medium goods vehicles and heavy goods vehicles must keep to the left most lane, or the lane next to the left most lane, of a road inside a tube of a left-driving tunnel.

img.alt: This figure is Figure No. 29—car symbol.
img.title: This image is Figure No. 29—Car Symbol.

schedule.text: This sign when displayed indicates that wind-susceptible vehicles are not allowed to proceed beyond the sign.

editorialNote.content:
Editorial Note:
* For the transitional provision relating to the amendment made by the Road Tunnels (Government) (Amendment) Regulation 2009 (L.N. 96 of 2009), please see section 12 of that Amendment Regulation.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Type A vehicle (甲類車輛) means a private car, taxi, motor cycle or motor tricycle;
Type C vehicle (丙類車輛) means a public or private double-decked bus, special purpose vehicle, or goods vehicle of a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 5.5 tonnes.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Removal fee
section.content: The removal fee for a Type A vehicle, Type B vehicle or Type C vehicle is set out in the Table.

schedule.name: sch2A
schedule.heading: Adjustments of Starting and End Time, Duration and Tolls etc. for Various Time Slots as a Result of Adjustments to Peak Time Slots by Authority

section.name: s1
section.heading: Determination of number of intervals—where toll difference is multiple of $2
section.leadIn: For a tunnel, where the toll difference for private cars between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an off-peak time slot (a.m.) and a peak time slot (a.m.);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a peak time slot (a.m.) and a normal time slot;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal time slot and a peak time slot (p.m.); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a peak time slot (p.m.) and an off-peak time slot (p.m.),

section.continued: is a multiple of $2, the number of intervals (N1) for the transitional time slot concerned between the respective time slots mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d), for motor cycles, motor tricycles and privates cars, is determined by dividing the toll difference between the respective time slots by $2, and then by subtracting 1 from the quotient.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Determination of number of intervals—where toll difference is not multiple of $2
section.leadIn: For a tunnel, where the toll difference for private cars between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an off-peak time slot (a.m.) and a peak time slot (a.m.);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a peak time slot (a.m.) and a normal time slot;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal time slot and a peak time slot (p.m.); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a peak time slot (p.m.) and an off-peak time slot (p.m.),

section.continued: is not a multiple of $2, the number of intervals (N2) for the transitional time slot concerned between the respective time slots mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d), for motor cycles, motor tricycles and private cars, is determined by dividing the toll difference between the respective time slots by $2, and then by rounding down the quotient to the nearest integer.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Time Slots other than Peak Time Slots

division.name: D1
division.heading: Off-peak Time Slot (A.M.)

section.name: s1
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of an off-peak time slot (a.m.) of a tunnel is the time immediately before the starting time of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of an off-peak time slot (a.m.) of a tunnel is the difference between 00:00 and the starting time of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of the tunnel.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Transitional Time Slot (Off-peak to Peak)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel is the time, when adding the duration of the time slot (determined in accordance with section 4 of this Division), that corresponds to the time immediately before the starting time of the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel is the time immediately before the starting time of the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Number of intervals
section.content: The number of intervals for a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel is N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel is the product of 2 minutes multiplying N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Where N1 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the off-peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel plus $0.8 with an increase of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) is the toll for private cars for the off-peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel plus $2 with an increase of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

subsection.leadIn: Where N2 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the off-peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel plus $0.4 with an increase of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (off-peak to peak) is the toll for private cars for the off-peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel plus $1 with an increase of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Transitional Time Slot (Peak to Normal)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel is the time immediately after the end time of the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel is the time, when deducting the duration of the time slot (determined in accordance with section 4 of this Division), that corresponds to the time immediately after the end time of the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Number of intervals
section.content: The number of intervals for a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel is N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel is the product of 2 minutes multiplying N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Where N1 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to normal) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel minus $0.8 with a decrease of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to normal) is the toll for private cars for the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel minus $2 with a decrease of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

subsection.leadIn: Where N2 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (peak to normal) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to normal) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel minus $0.8 with a decrease of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval (except the last interval) and a decrease of $0.4 in the toll for the last interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to normal) is the toll for private cars for the peak time slot (a.m.) of the tunnel minus $2 with a decrease of $2 in the toll for each successive interval (except the last interval) and a decrease of $1 in the toll for the last interval.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Normal Time Slot

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of a normal time slot of a tunnel is the time immediately after the end time of the transitional time slot (peak to normal) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of a normal time slot of a tunnel is the time immediately before the starting time of the transitional time slot (normal to peak) of the tunnel.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Transitional Time Slot (Normal to Peak)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel is the time, when adding the duration of the time slot (determined in accordance with section 4 of this Division), that corresponds to the time immediately before the starting time of the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel is the time immediately before the starting time of the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Number of intervals
section.content: The number of intervals for a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel is N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel is the product of 2 minutes multiplying N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Where N1 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (normal to peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the normal time slot of the tunnel plus $0.8 with an increase of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (normal to peak) is the toll for private cars for the normal time slot of the tunnel plus $2 with an increase of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

subsection.leadIn: Where N2 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (normal to peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (normal to peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the normal time slot of the tunnel plus $0.4 with an increase of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (normal to peak) is the toll for private cars for the normal time slot of the tunnel plus $1 with an increase of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Transitional Time Slot (Peak to Off-peak)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel is the time immediately after the end time of the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: End time
section.content: The end time of a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel is the time, when deducting the duration of the time slot (determined in accordance with section 4 of this Division), that corresponds to the time immediately after the end time of the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Number of intervals
section.content: The number of intervals for a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel is N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel is the product of 2 minutes multiplying N1 or N2 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Where N1 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel minus $0.8 with a decrease of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) is the toll for private cars for the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel minus $2 with a decrease of $2 in the toll for each successive interval.

subsection.leadIn: Where N2 is the number of intervals determined under Part 1 of this Schedule in relation to a transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of a tunnel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for motor cycles and motor tricycles, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) is the toll for motor cycles and motor tricycles for the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel minus $0.8 with a decrease of $0.8 in the toll for each successive interval (except the last interval) and a decrease of $0.4 in the toll for the last interval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for private cars, the toll for the first interval of the transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) is the toll for private cars for the peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel minus $2 with a decrease of $2 in the toll for each successive interval (except the last interval) and a decrease of $1 in the toll for the last interval.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Off-peak Time Slot (P.M.)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Starting time
section.content: The starting time of an off-peak time slot (p.m.) of a tunnel is the time immediately after the end time of the transitional time slot (peak to off-peak) of the tunnel.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Duration
section.content: The duration of an off-peak time slot (p.m.) of a tunnel is the difference between the starting time of the off-peak time slot (p.m.) of the tunnel and the time immediately before 00:00 of the next day.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Surcharges Applicable to Boothless Mode Tunnel

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In relation to the responsible person of a vehicle that used a boothless mode tunnel—
section.def: T amount (隧道費款額) means an amount of toll payable for the use of the tunnel by the vehicle on a single occasion which is not paid in full in accordance with regulation 12AAC;

T+ amount (隧道費連首筆附加費總額) means an amount that—(a)comprises—(i)a T amount; and(ii)the initial surcharge payable under regulation 12AAF(2) for the T amount; and(b)is not paid in full by the expiry of 21 days after the date on which a surcharge notice relating to the T amount is served.

td.p: Initial surcharge for every T amount
Further surcharge for every T+ amount
